summary: A brief email from May 9, 2019, requesting a meeting from an individual identified as the Co-Chief of the Public Corruption Unit at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, regarding Epstein. The document is a direct communication from a key prosecutor's office.

persons.name: Co-Chief, Public Corruption Unit
persons.context: The sender of the email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, requesting a meeting regarding Epstein.

events.title: Email Request for Meeting on Epstein
events.description: An email is sent from the Co-Chief of the Public Corruption Unit at the SDNY requesting a meeting regarding Epstein.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) was actively communicating about Epstein as of May 2019.
The communication originated from the Co-Chief of the Public Corruption Unit, indicating the case intersected with public corruption concerns.
The email is a direct, internal request for a meeting, suggesting ongoing investigative or legal activity.
